facts.text: One Ram Adhar and the respondents were co-tenants of certain lands situated at Bibiganj, District Sultanpur.

Appellant Patiraji took proceedings under the U.P. Tenancy Act, 1939 for declaration that she was widow of Ram Adhar and became co-tenant with respondents. Succeeded before Assistant Collector but lost in appeal before Additional Commissioner and Board of Revenue on July 1, 1954, holding she was not the widow.
U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950 came into force on July 1, 1952.
Appellant's name recorded as occupant in Khasra of 1356F: 'Ram Adhar Pandey Bakasht Waris Baqa biz Smt. Patraji Motwaffi Bewa Ram Adhar Panedy Tarikh 24-2-49 Se'.
Appellant brought suit under section 20(b)(i) read with section 232 of the Act claiming Adhivasi rights and possession, alleging unlawful dispossession by respondents.
Trial court (Additional Commissioner?) dismissed suit; on appeal, Additional Commissioner allowed Patiraji's appeal and decreed suit.
Board of Revenue dismissed respondents' appeal against Additional Commissioner's decision.
Respondents filed writ petition in Allahabad High Court; single Judge allowed it, holding entry in Khasra 1356F only for part of year, no Adhivasi rights.
Special Appeal No. 344 of 1966 against High Court single Judge dismissed in limine by Division Bench on October 31, 1966.
Entry in Khasra 1356F appeared for a part of the year only.

legal_issues.text: Whether the appellant Patiraji is entitled to Adhivasi rights under section 20(b)(i) of the U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950 based on entry in Khasra of 1356F.

petitioner_arguments.text: Appellant recorded as occupant in Khasra 1356F, therefore entitled to Adhivasi rights under section 20(b)(i) and possession.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Section 20(b)(i) of U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950

petitioner_arguments.text: Last entry-holder should be recognised as occupant to exclusion of others.

respondent_arguments.text: Entry in favour of appellant appeared in Khasra 1356F for a part of the year only, therefore not entitled to Adhivasi rights.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Section 20(b)(i) of U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950

court_reasoning.text: Adhivasi rights under section 20(b)(i) claimed by those recorded as occupants for the whole of Fasli year 1356F only, not part of the year. Provision confers special rights even to trespassers, must be construed strictly per language. Other view unworkable, encourages lawlessness.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Rights available only to those recorded as occupants for entire Fasli year 1356.

court_reasoning.text: Under Land Records Manual, Lekhpal inspects thrice yearly; multiple occupants possible, but none qualify unless sole for whole year. Last holder argument lacks logic, encourages lawlessness.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Allahabad High Court and Board of Revenue uniformly hold full year recording required.

court_reasoning.text: Board of Revenue erred in instant case by assuming appellant sole heir of Ram Adhar, contrary to earlier proceedings.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Appellant not widow, no other heirship traced.

holdings.text: Adhivasi rights under section 20(b)(i) available only to persons recorded as occupants for the entire Fasli year 1356F.

precedents_cited.case_name: Shyam Sunar Lal v. Mangali and Ors.
precedents_cited.relevance: Supports view that full year recording required for section 20(b)(i) rights.

precedents_cited.case_name: Ram Chander and Anr. v. Chhotu
precedents_cited.relevance: Supports view that full year recording required for section 20(b)(i) rights.
Supports view that full year recording required for section 20(b)(i) rights.

statutes_cited.name: U.P. Zamindari Abolition and Land Reforms Act, 1950
statutes_cited.relevance: Confers Adhivasi rights to those recorded as occupants in Khasra/Khatauni of 1356F for whole year; suit under 20(b)(i) r/w 232.

statutes_cited.name: U.P. Tenancy Act, 1939
statutes_cited.relevance: Proceedings for declaration of widowhood and co-tenancy.

statutes_cited.name: Uttar Pradesh Land Records Manual
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs Lekhpal inspections and Khasra entries for occupants.

outcome.summary: Appeal by special leave dismissed. Appellant not entitled to Adhivasi rights under section 20(b)(i) as recorded only for part of Fasli year 1356F.

key_quotes.text: 'Every person who was recorded as occupant of any land in the Khasra or Khatauni of 1356F shall be called Adhivasi of the land and shall... be entitled to take or retain possession thereof.'
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: Adhivasi rights can be claimed by those persons only who are recorded as occupants for the whole of the Fasli year 1356.
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: Special rights conferred by the Act ought to be subject to the special limitations imposed by the Act.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Justifies strict construction against liberal view.
